metadata.Title: CVE-2020-26154 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
url.cpp in libproxy through 0.4.15 is prone to a buffer overflow when PAC is enabled, as demonstrated by a large PAC file that is delivered without a Content-length header.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-26154` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libproxy-tools - 0.4.11-5ubuntu1.2
libproxy0.4-cil - 0.4.11-5ubuntu1.2
libproxy1-plugin-gsettings - 0.4.11-5ubuntu1.2
libproxy1-plugin-kconfig - 0.4.11-5ubuntu1.2
libproxy1-plugin-networkmanager - 0.4.11-5ubuntu1.2
libproxy1-plugin-webkit - 0.4.11-5ubuntu1.2
libproxy1v5 - 0.4.11-5ubuntu1.2
python-libproxy - 0.4.11-5ubuntu1.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libproxy package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.4.11-5ubuntu1.2').
